Barbara Liskov

Biography

Barbara Liskov, n√©e Barbara Jane Huberman, was born on November 7, 1939, in California. She earned her BA in mathematics at the University of California, Berkeley in 1961. Rather than go directly to graduate school, she took a job at the Mitre Corporation where she learned that she was a natural at computer programming. After a year at Mitre, she moved to Harvard to work on computer translation of human languages.

Other Important Contribution
1985 Argus Language
2004 Won the John von Neumann Medal
